(2016). Students’ Responses to Curricular Activities as Indicator of Coherence in Project-Based Science In Looi, C. K., Polman, J. L., Cress, U., and Reimann, P. (Eds.). Transforming Learning, Empowering Learners: The International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2016, Volume 2. Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences, pp. 35-43. https://doi.dx.org/10.22318/icls2016.120 Project-based learning seeks to engage students through sustained investigation of real-world problems or design challenges. Weekly mini-surveys were administered to students during an 8-week project-based learning unit to understand students’ perceptions of alignment of lessons to the overall challenge, their affective responses to lessons, and how these varied across lesson types and teachers. Results from a multilevel model revealed significant teacher level variance; no differences across lesson types were found. en Singapore: International Society of the Learning Sciences Students’ Responses to Curricular Activities as Indicator of Coherence in Project-Based Science Book chapter <dc:subject xml:lang="en">project-based learning</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">science</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">practical measurement</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">coherence</dc:subject> <dc:subject xml:lang="en">student affect</dc:subject>
